name: Adobo
description: A savory and slightly sour pork or chicken dish stewed in soy sauce and vinegar.
ingredients: 1 kg pork belly, cut into chunks
steps: In a pot, combine pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 45 minutes to 1 hour until meat is tender.
Remove the pork from the sauce and fry in a pan until browned.
Return the fried pork to the sauce and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
Adjust seasoning with salt if necessary. Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Sinigang na Baboy
description: A sour tamarind soup with pork and assorted vegetables.
ingredients: 1 kg pork ribs or belly, cut into pieces
200 grams tamarind pulp or sinigang mix
1 cup string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
Salt or fish sauce to taste
steps: In a large pot, boil water and add pork, onion, and tomatoes. Simmer until pork is tender.
Add tamarind pulp or sinigang mix and stir well.
Add radish, okra, string beans, and eggplant. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add kangkong leaves and simmer for 2 more minutes.
Season with salt or fish sauce to taste. Serve hot with rice.

name: Kare-Kare
description: A rich peanut-based stew with oxtail and vegetables.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons annatto seeds soaked in 1/4 cup water
1 cup string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
steps: Boil oxtail until tender, skimming off any scum that rises.
In a separate pan, sauté annatto water to extract color.
Add peanut butter and ground toasted rice to the broth, stirring until well combined.
Add annatto extract to the pot and mix well.
Add eggplant, banana blossom, and string beans. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Add bok choy and simmer for 2 more minutes.
Serve hot with shrimp paste on the side.

name: Lechon Kawali
description: Crispy deep-fried pork belly served with dipping sauce.
steps: In a pot, boil pork belly with salt, peppercorns, and bay leaves until tender.
Remove pork and let it dry completely. Refrigerate for a few hours or overnight for better results.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or deep pan.
Carefully deep-fry the pork belly until golden and crispy.
Let it rest for a few minutes before chopping. Serve with lechon sauce or spiced vinegar.

name: Tinolang Manok
description: A ginger-based chicken soup with green papaya and chili leaves.
ingredients: 1 kg chicken, cut into serving pieces
1 medium green papaya, peeled and sliced
1 cup chili leaves or malunggay leaves
steps: In a pot, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in fish sauce and water. Bring to a boil and simmer until chicken is tender.
Add green papaya slices and cook until tender.
Add chili leaves and simmer for 2 more minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

name: Pancit Canton
description: Stir-fried egg noodles with vegetables, meat, and shrimp.
ingredients: Calamansi or lemon wedges for serving
steps: In a wok, sauté garlic and onion until translucent.
Add chicken and cook until no longer pink. Add shrimp and cook until opaque.
Add carrots, bell pepper, and cabbage. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Bring to a boil.
Add pancit canton noodles and cook until noodles absorb the liquid and are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with calamansi or lemon wedges.

name: Bulalo
description: A hearty beef marrow stew with corn and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 kg beef shanks with bone marrow
2 corn on the cob, cut into pieces
Fish sauce or salt to taste
steps: In a large pot, boil beef shanks, onion, and peppercorns. Simmer until meat is tender, about 2-3 hours.
Add corn and potatoes. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce or salt to taste.
Add pechay and simmer for 2 more minutes.
Serve hot with rice and fish sauce with chili on the side.

name: Bicol Express
description: Spicy pork stew cooked in coconut milk and chili peppers.
ingredients: 10 pieces bird's eye chilies, sliced (adjust to taste)
steps: In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork belly and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a boil. Simmer until pork is tender.
Add chilies and coconut cream. Continue to simmer until sauce thickens.
Season with salt if necessary. Serve hot with rice.

name: Inihaw na Liempo
description: Grilled pork belly marinated in a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1/4 cup calamansi juice or lemon juice
steps: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, calamansi juice, garlic, brown sugar, and black pepper.
Marinate pork belly in the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat grill to medium heat.
Skewer pork belly slices if desired. Grill each side until cooked through and slightly charred.
Baste with remaining marinade while grilling. Serve hot with spiced vinegar.

name: Laing
description: Taro leaves cooked in coconut milk with shrimp paste and chilies.
steps: In a pot, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add shrimp paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in coconut milk and bring to a boil.
Add taro leaves, pressing down to absorb the liquid. Do not stir to avoid itching sensation.
Simmer until taro leaves are tender and liquid is reduced.
Add coconut cream and chilies. Cook for another 10 minutes until sauce thickens.
Season with salt if necessary. Serve with rice.

name: Kaldereta
description: A spicy tomato-based stew with beef and vegetables.
steps: In a pot, heat oil and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add beef cubes and cook until browned.
Pour in tomato sauce and beef broth. Bring to a boil and simmer until beef is tender.
Add liver spread and mix well.
Add potatoes, carrots, and bell peppers. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt, pepper, and chili flakes if desired.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Paksiw na Pata
description: Pork hock stewed in vinegar and soy sauce with banana blossoms.
steps: In a pot, combine pork hock, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, brown sugar, peppercorns, and bay leaves.
Add enough water to cover the meat. Bring to a boil and simmer until pork is tender.
Add dried banana blossoms and cook for another 15 minutes.
Adjust seasoning with salt if necessary.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Pinakbet
description: Mixed vegetables steamed in fish sauce with pork.
ingredients: 1 cup long beans (sitaw), cut into 2-inch pieces
steps: In a pan, sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until soft.
Add pork belly and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add squash and a little water. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add the remaining vegetables. Cover and cook until all are tender.
Season with salt and pepper if necessary. Serve hot.

name: Ginataang Gulay
description: Vegetables cooked in coconut milk.
ingredients: 100 grams string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
steps: In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add shrimp paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add squash and coconut milk. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add eggplant and string beans. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rice.

name: Arroz Caldo
description: A comforting rice porridge with chicken and ginger.
ingredients: Spring onions and fried garlic for garnish
Calamansi or lemon wedges for serving
steps: In a pot, sauté garlic, onion, and ginger until fragrant.
Add chicken pieces and cook until no longer pink.
Add glutinous rice and stir for 2 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and fish sauce. Bring to a boil.
Simmer while stirring occasionally until rice is fully cooked and porridge has thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot topped with spring onions and fried garlic, with calamansi on the side.

name: Lumpiang Shanghai
description: Deep-fried spring rolls filled with ground pork and vegetables.
ingredients: Sweet and sour sauce for dipping
steps: In a bowl, mix ground pork, carrot, onion, garlic, egg, salt, and pepper.
Wrap a tablespoon of filling in each lumpia wrapper.
Heat oil in a deep pan. Fry lumpia until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with dipping sauce.

name: Sinigang na Hipon
description: A sour tamarind soup with shrimp and vegetables.
ingredients: 200 grams tamarind pulp or sinigang mix
1 cup string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
Salt or fish sauce to taste
steps: Boil water in a pot. Add onion and tomatoes. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add tamarind pulp or sinigang mix. Stir well.
Add radish, okra, string beans, and eggplant. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add shrimp and cook until pink and opaque.
Add kangkong leaves and simmer for 2 more minutes.
Season with salt or fish sauce. Serve hot.

name: Tortang Talong
description: Grilled eggplant omelette with ground meat.
steps: Grill or broil eggplants until skin is charred. Let cool and peel off skin, keeping the stem intact.
Flatten the eggplants using a fork.
In a pan, sauté garlic and onion. Add ground meat and cook until browned. Season with salt and pepper.
Place some cooked meat on top of each flattened eggplant.
Dip the eggplant with meat into the beaten eggs, coating well.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the eggplant until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with ketchup or preferred dipping sauce.

name: Bopis
description: Spicy minced pork lungs and heart sautéed in chilies and onions.
ingredients: 500 grams pork lungs and heart, cleaned and minced
steps: Boil minced pork lungs and heart until tender. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add minced organs and cook for 5 minutes.
Pour in vinegar and soy sauce. Do not stir for a few minutes to cook off the vinegar.
Add chilies and bell pepper. Stir and cook for another 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with rice.

name: Sisig
description: Chopped pig's head and liver seasoned with calamansi and chili peppers.
steps: Boil pig's face until tender. Grill until crispy then chop into small pieces.
Grill chicken liver until cooked and chop finely.
In a pan, sauté onions until translucent.
Add chopped meat and liver. Stir in soy sauce and cook for 5 minutes.
Season with calamansi juice, chilies, salt, and pepper.
Optional: Add mayonnaise for a creamy texture.
Serve on a sizzling plate if available.

name: Ginisang Monggo
description: Mung bean stew with spinach and pork.
ingredients: 1 cup spinach or bitter melon leaves
Fish sauce or salt to taste
steps: Boil mung beans in water until soft. Set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic, onion, and tomatoes until soft.
Add pork and cook until browned.
Pour in the cooked mung beans with its liquid. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Add spinach or bitter melon leaves and cook until wilted.
Season with fish sauce or salt. Serve hot.

name: Chicken Inasal
description: Grilled chicken marinated in lemongrass and annatto oil.
steps: In a bowl, mix calamansi juice, ginger, garlic, lemongrass, brown sugar, salt, and pepper.
Marinate chicken pieces in the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Preheat grill to medium heat.
Skewer chicken pieces if desired. Grill while basting with annatto oil until cooked through.
Serve hot with rice and dipping sauce.

name: Binagoongan
description: Pork stewed in shrimp paste and tomatoes.
ingredients: 1 kg pork belly, cut into cubes
steps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft.
Add pork belly and cook until lightly browned.
Stir in shrimp paste and cook for 3 minutes.
Pour in vinegar and let it simmer without stirring for a few minutes.
Add water and sugar if using. Simmer until pork is tender and sauce thickens.
Adjust seasoning as needed. Serve hot with rice.

name: Longganisa
description: Filipino sweet or garlicky pork sausages.
steps: In a large bowl, combine ground pork, brown sugar, vinegar, minced garlic, paprika, black pepper, and salt.
Mix thoroughly until well combined.
Stuff the mixture into sausage casings or shape into logs using wax paper.
Refrigerate overnight to allow flavors to meld.
To cook, place sausages in a pan with a little water. Simmer until water evaporates, then add oil and fry until browned.
Serve hot with garlic rice and eggs.

name: Crispy Pata
description: Deep-fried pork knuckles served with soy-vinegar dip.
steps: In a large pot, boil pork leg with salt, peppercorns, bay leaves, and garlic until meat is tender (about 1.5 to 2 hours).
Remove the pork leg from the pot and allow it to dry completely. For best results, refrigerate overnight.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot.
Carefully deep-fry the pork leg until skin is crispy and golden brown.
Prepare the dipping sauce by mixing vinegar, soy sauce, onion, garlic, and chili.
Let the crispy pata rest before chopping. Serve with the dipping sauce.

name: Tapsilog
description: Cured beef, fried rice, and fried egg breakfast combo.
ingredients: 1/4 cup calamansi juice or lemon juice
steps: Marinate beef slices in soy sauce, calamansi juice, garlic, brown sugar, and black pepper for at least 4 hours or overnight.
Fry the marinated beef in hot oil until cooked to your liking.
For garlic rice, sauté minced garlic in oil until golden brown.
Add cooked rice and stir-fry until well combined. Season with salt.
Serve beef tapa with garlic rice and fried egg. Enjoy with vinegar dipping sauce if desired.

name: Dinuguan
description: Savory stew of pork and pig's blood with vinegar and spices.
ingredients: 1 kg pork belly, cut into small cubes
steps: In a pot, heat oil and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until lightly browned.
Pour in vinegar and let it boil without stirring for 5 minutes.
Add water and fish sauce. Simmer until pork is tender.
Slowly pour in pig's blood while stirring continuously to prevent coagulation.
Add green chilies and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with steamed rice or puto.

name: Chicharon Bulaklak
description: Deep-fried pork mesentery served as a crispy snack.
steps: Boil the pork mesentery in water with salt, vinegar, garlic, and peppercorns until tender.
Remove from pot and allow to drain and dry completely.
Heat oil in a deep fryer or deep pan.
Deep-fry the pork mesentery until golden brown and crispy.
Drain excess oil on paper towels.
Serve with spiced vinegar as a dipping sauce.

name: Kutsinta
description: Sticky rice cakes made from rice flour and lye water.
steps: In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, glutinous rice flour, and brown sugar.
Dissolve annatto powder in water, then add to the dry ingredients. Mix well.
Add lye water and stir until batter is smooth.
Grease puto molds with oil and pour the batter into each mold.
Steam over boiling water for 30 to 40 minutes or until set.
Allow to cool before removing from molds.
Serve with grated coconut on top.

name: Bibingka
description: Baked rice cake with salted eggs and cheese.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Line cake pans with banana leaves and brush with butter.
In a bowl, sift together rice flour, all-purpose flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, beat eggs, then add coconut milk and melted butter.
Combine wet and dry ingredients, mixing until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pans.
Top with salted egg slices and grated cheese.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Brush with butter and sprinkle with grated coconut before serving.

name: Champorado
description: Chocolate rice porridge served with milk.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cocoa powder or tablea chocolate, dissolved
Evaporated milk or condensed milk for topping
steps: In a pot, bring water to a boil.
Add glutinous rice and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
Once rice is nearly cooked, add dissolved cocoa powder or melted tablea.
Stir in sugar and a pinch of salt. Continue cooking until rice is fully cooked and mixture thickens.
Serve hot in bowls with a swirl of milk on top.

name: Ube Halaya
description: Purple yam jam often used in desserts.
ingredients: 1 kg purple yam (ube), boiled and grated
steps: Melt butter in a large pan over low heat.
Add grated ube and stir well.
Pour in condensed milk, evaporated milk, and coconut milk.
Add sugar and continue to cook over low heat, stirring constantly to prevent sticking.
Cook until the mixture becomes thick and sticky (about 30 to 45 minutes).
Add ube flavoring if a deeper color or flavor is desired.
Transfer to molds or containers and allow to cool.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

name: Sapin-Sapin
description: A colorful layered sticky rice cake with different flavors.
steps: In a mixing bowl, combine glutinous rice flour, sugar, and coconut milk. Mix until smooth.
Divide the mixture evenly into three parts.
Add mashed ube and purple food coloring to the first part, mashed jackfruit and yellow food coloring to the second, and leave the third part plain.
Grease a round baking pan and pour the first layer (e.g., purple mixture). Steam for 15 minutes.
Pour the second layer (e.g., plain mixture) over the first and steam for another 15 minutes.
Pour the third layer (e.g., yellow mixture) and steam for an additional 15 minutes or until set.
Allow to cool before slicing.
Top with coconut curds before serving.

name: Turon
description: Deep-fried banana rolls coated with caramelized sugar.
steps: Place a slice of banana and jackfruit on a spring roll wrapper.
Sprinkle with brown sugar.
Roll tightly and seal the edges with water.
Heat oil in a pan and fry the rolls until golden brown.
Sprinkle extra brown sugar while frying to caramelize.
Drain on paper towels.
Serve warm.

name: Buko Pie
description: Coconut custard pie with a flaky crust.
steps: Prepare the crust by mixing flour and salt. Cut in cold butter until crumbly.
Add cold water gradually and mix until dough forms.
Divide the dough into two, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
For the filling, combine coconut water, evaporated milk, sugar, and cornstarch in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until thickened.
Add shredded coconut and vanilla extract. Cool the filling.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Roll out one dough portion and line a pie pan.
Pour in the cooled filling.
Roll out the second dough portion and place over the filling. Seal and crimp the edges.
Cut slits on top to allow steam to escape.
Bake for 45 to 60 minutes or until crust is golden brown.
Cool before slicing.

name: Halo-Halo
description: A cold dessert with mixed fruits, beans, jellies, and shaved ice.
steps: In a tall glass, layer 1 to 2 tablespoons of each sweetened ingredient at the bottom.
Add shaved or crushed ice on top.
Pour evaporated milk over the ice.
Top with leche flan slice, ube halaya, and ube ice cream if desired.
Serve immediately with a spoon. Mix before eating.

name: Puto Bumbong
description: Purple rice cakes steamed in bamboo tubes.
ingredients: 1/2 cup ube powder or purple food coloring
steps: Combine glutinous rice flour and ube powder in a bowl.
Gradually add water and mix until a dough forms.
Roll the dough into small logs that fit into bamboo tubes or molds.
Steam the dough in bamboo tubes or on banana leaves for about 3 to 5 minutes.
Remove from the steamer and spread with butter or margarine.
Serve on banana leaves topped with grated coconut and muscovado sugar.

name: Empanada
description: Pastry stuffed with meat, vegetables, and sometimes eggs.
steps: Prepare the filling by sautéing garlic and onion in oil.
Add ground meat and cook until browned.
Add potatoes, carrots, raisins, and peas. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with salt and pepper. Cool the filling.
For the dough, mix flour, baking powder, and salt.
Cut in cold butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Add cold water gradually and mix until dough forms.
Knead gently, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Roll out the dough and cut into circles.
Place filling on one side of each circle, fold over, and seal the edges.
Brush with beaten egg.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Alternatively, deep-fry until golden.

name: Pandesal
description: Soft bread rolls commonly eaten for breakfast.
steps: In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm milk. Let stand until foamy.
In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, and salt.
Add yeast mixture, melted butter, and egg to the dry ingredients.
Mix until a soft dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface until smooth and elastic (about 10 minutes).
Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover, and let it rise until doubled in size.
Punch down the dough and divide into small portions. Shape each into a ball.
Roll each ball in bread crumbs and place on a baking sheet.
Cover and let rise again until doubled.
Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Serve warm.

name: Ensaladang Talong
description: Grilled eggplant salad with tomatoes and onions.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons fish sauce or salt to taste
steps: Grill or broil eggplants until skin is charred and flesh is soft.
Allow eggplants to cool, then peel off the skin.
Chop or mash the eggplant flesh and place in a bowl.
Add diced tomatoes and onions.
In a separate bowl, mix vinegar, fish sauce or salt, sugar, and black pepper.
Pour the dressing over the eggplant mixture and toss gently.
Adjust seasoning as needed.
Serve as a side dish or salad.

name: Bistek Tagalog
description: Beef slices marinated in soy sauce and calamansi juice, topped with onions.
ingredients: 1 kg beef sirloin or flank steak, thinly sliced
steps: In a bowl, marinate beef slices in soy sauce, calamansi juice, minced garlic, and black pepper for at least 1 hour.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté onion rings until translucent. Remove and set aside.
In the same pan, fry the marinated beef slices until browned. Do this in batches if necessary.
Pour the marinade into the pan and add a little water if needed. Simmer until beef is tender.
Adjust seasoning with salt if necessary.
Top with sautéed onions before serving.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Leche Flan
description: A rich custard dessert topped with caramelized sugar.
steps: Prepare the caramel by melting sugar in a saucepan over low heat until golden brown.
Quickly pour the caramel into llanera molds or a baking dish, swirling to coat the bottom evenly. Set aside to cool.
In a bowl, gently whisk egg yolks to avoid creating bubbles.
Add condensed milk, evaporated milk, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
Strain the mixture to remove any lumps.
Pour the custard mixture into the caramel-lined molds.
Cover molds with aluminum foil.
Steam over medium heat for about 30 to 35 minutes, or until set. Alternatively, bake in a water bath at 350°F (175°C) for about 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Let the flan cool before refrigerating.
To serve, run a knife around the edges and invert onto a serving plate.

name: Palabok
description: Rice noodles with shrimp sauce, topped with smoked fish flakes and chicharron.
ingredients: 1/4 cup shrimp broth (from boiled shrimp shells)
Calamansi or lemon wedges for serving
steps: Soak annatto seeds in 1/2 cup hot water to extract color. Set aside.
Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add shrimp and cook until pink.
Pour in shrimp broth, annatto water (strained), and fish sauce.
In a small bowl, dissolve 1/4 cup cornstarch in 1/2 cup water. Add to the pan and stir until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place noodles on a serving platter. Pour the sauce over the noodles.
Top with crushed chicharron, tinapa flakes, sliced eggs, and chopped spring onions.
Serve with calamansi or lemon wedges.

name: Lomi
description: Thick egg noodle soup with pork, liver, and vegetables.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons cornstarch dissolved in 1/4 cup water
Fish sauce or salt to taste
steps: In a pot, heat oil and sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add pork and cook until no longer pink.
Add liver and shrimp, cook for 2 minutes.
Pour in broth and bring to a boil.
Add lomi noodles and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add soy sauce and vegetables (carrots and cabbage). Cook until vegetables are tender.
Stir in cornstarch slurry to thicken the soup.
Slowly pour in beaten eggs while stirring gently to create egg strands.
Season with fish sauce or salt.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped spring onions.

name: Camote Cue
description: Deep-fried sweet potatoes coated with caramelized brown sugar.
ingredients: 4 large sweet potatoes (camote), peeled and sliced thickly
steps: Heat oil in a deep pan suitable for frying.
Add brown sugar to the hot oil and allow it to melt slightly.
Carefully add sweet potato slices into the oil.
Fry until sweet potatoes are cooked and sugar sticks to them, about 8-10 minutes.
Stir occasionally to coat the slices evenly with caramelized sugar.
Remove from oil and let excess oil drip.
Skewer the sweet potato slices onto bamboo sticks.
Allow to cool slightly before serving.

name: Dinengdeng
description: Vegetable dish with grilled fish and fermented fish sauce.
ingredients: 1 medium-sized grilled fish (e.g., bangus or tilapia), flaked
Assorted vegetables (e.g., squash flowers, eggplant, bitter melon, okra, string beans)
steps: In a pot, bring water to a boil.
Add onions, tomatoes, and ginger. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Add fermented fish sauce to the broth.
Add harder vegetables first (e.g., eggplant, bitter melon) and cook until partially tender.
Add softer vegetables (e.g., squash flowers, okra, string beans) and cook until all vegetables are tender.
Add the flaked grilled fish and simmer for another 2 minutes.
Adjust seasoning with salt if necessary.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Pinangat
description: Fish or shrimp cooked in sour broth with tomatoes and tamarind.
ingredients: 500 grams fish (e.g., tilapia, mackerel) or shrimp
2 cups tamarind broth or tamarind mix
Salt or fish sauce to taste
steps: In a pot, combine water, tamarind broth, onions, and tomatoes. Bring to a boil.
Add the fish or shrimp to the pot.
Add mustard leaves or kamias if using.
Add green chilies.
Simmer until the fish or shrimp is cooked through.
Season with salt or fish sauce to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Chicken Adobo
description: Chicken stewed in soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic.
steps: In a pot, combine chicken, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, and peppercorns.
Pour in water and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for about 30 minutes or until chicken is tender.
Remove the chicken pieces from the sauce.
In a separate pan, heat oil and fry the chicken until lightly browned.
Return the fried chicken to the sauce and simmer for another 10 minutes.
Adjust seasoning with salt if necessary.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Pancit Palabok
description: Rice noodles with a rich shrimp sauce and various toppings.
ingredients: 1/2 cup annatto water (annatto seeds soaked in water)
3 tablespoons cornstarch dissolved in 1/2 cup water
2 cups shrimp stock (from boiled shrimp shells)
steps: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, sauté garlic and onion until fragrant.
Add ground pork and cook until browned.
Add shrimp and cook until pink.
Pour in shrimp stock, annatto water, and fish sauce. Bring to a boil.
Add cornstarch slurry and stir until sauce thickens.
Season with salt and pepper.
Place noodles on a serving platter and pour sauce over them.
Top with chicharron, tinapa flakes, sliced eggs, spring onions, and fried garlic bits.
Serve with lemon or calamansi wedges.

name: Nilagang Baka
description: Beef stew with potatoes, cabbage, and vegetables.
ingredients: 1 kg beef shank or brisket, cut into chunks
1 corn on the cob, cut into pieces (optional)
Fish sauce or salt to taste
steps: In a large pot, boil beef with water, onion, and peppercorns. Simmer until beef is tender (about 2 hours).
Skim off any scum that rises to the top.
Add potatoes and corn. Cook until vegetables are tender.
Season with fish sauce or salt.
Add pechay or cabbage and cook for another 2 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice and fish sauce with calamansi on the side.
